get.description: Retrieving information of all placed orders.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: How many orders per page. Max: 100. Default: 100.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort orders by field. Available sort options: created_at_asc, created_at_desc. Default: created_at_desc.

parameters.name: created_at[from]
parameters.description: Optional. Where order creation time is equal or greater. Example: 2018-09-01

parameters.name: created_at[to]
parameters.description: Optional. Where order creation time is equal or less. Example: 2018-09-30

code-samples.code:
curl -H "Authorization: Token YOUR_APP_TOKEN" https://api.coingate.com/v2/orders?per_page=2&page=1&sort=created_at_desc

# Filter by created_at[from]=2022-01-01&created_at[to]=2022-12-31
curl -H 'Authorization: Token YOUR_APP_TOKEN' "https://api.coingate.com/v2/orders?created_at%5Bfrom%5D=2022-01-01&created_at%5Bto%5D=2022-12-31"

post.description:
Create order at CoinGate and redirect shopper to invoice (payment_url). 
This is private API endpoint and requires [authentication](https://developer.coingate.com/docs/api-authentication).

order_id.description: Merchant's custom order ID. We recommend using a unique order ID. Example: *CGORDER-12345*.

price_amount.description: The price set by the merchant. Example: *1050.99*.

price_currency.description: [ISO 4217](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code which defines the currency in which you wish to price your merchandise; used to define price parameter. [Supported currencies](https://developer.coingate.com/docs/currencies)

receive_currency.description: [ISO 4217](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code which defines the currency in which you wish to receive your settlements. Currency conversions are done by CoinGate. Possible values: fiat - *EUR*; stablecoin - *USDT*; crypto: *BTC*, *LTC*, *ETH* or *DO_NOT_CONVERT*. **Note**: use *DO_NOT_CONVERT* to keep payments received in original currency (Altcoin payments will be converted to BTC). With *DO_NOT_CONVERT* you can also extend invoice expiration time up to 24 hours. [Supported currencies](https://developer.coingate.com/docs/currencies)

title.description: Max 150 characters. Example: product title (Apple iPhone 6), order id (MyShop Order #12345), cart id (Cart #00004335).

description.description: More details about this order. Max 500 characters. It can be cart items, product details or other information. Example: 1 x Apple iPhone 6, 1 x Apple MacBook Air.

callback_url.description: Send an automated message to Merchant URL when order status is changed. For testing you can use [requestcatcher.com](https://requestcatcher.com) tool.

cancel_url.description: Redirect to Merchant URL when buyer cancels the order

success_url.description: Redirect to Merchant URL after successful payment

token.description: Your custom token to validate payment callback (notification).

purchaser_email.description: Email address of the purchaser (payee) provided will be pre-filled on the invoice.

code-samples.code:
curl -X "POST" "https://api.coingate.com/v2/orders" \
     -H 'Authorization: Token 1234' \
     -H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8' \
     --data-urlencode "title=Order #111" \
     --data-urlencode "price_amount=1149" \
     --data-urlencode "price_currency=EUR" \
     --data-urlencode "receive_currency=EUR" \
     --data-urlencode "callback_url=https://example.com/test" \
     --data-urlencode "success_url=http://example.com/success" \
     --data-urlencode "cancel_url=http://example.com/cancel" \
     --data-urlencode "order_id=111" \
     --data-urlencode "description=1 x MacBook Air 13.3\" Retina M1 8-core CPU 7-core GPU/8GB/256GB/Gold/INT"

get.description: A health check endpoint for CoinGate API. This endpoint is public, authentication is not required.
Current exchange rate for any two currencies, fiat or crypto. This endpoint is public, authentication is not required.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: ISO Symbol. Example: EUR, USD, BTC, ETH, [etc](https://coingate.com/currencies).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: ISO Symbol. Example: EUR, USD, BTC, ETH, [etc](https://coingate.com/currencies).

get.description:
Before making a GET order request, a user should have an already CREATED order, which can be paid or canceled. To CREATE ORDER, please follow the instructions here https://developer.coingate.com/docs/create-order 

After creating an order, you will get an ORDER ID. This ID will be used for GET ORDER requests.

Please, take into account that before creating requests within the CoinGate system, the user should have an authentication token. To have it, please follow the instructions here https://developer.coingate.com/docs/api-authentication
Current CoinGate exchange rates for Merchants and Traders. This endpoint is public, authentication is not required.

post.description:
Placing [created order](doc:create-order) with pre-selected payment currency (BTC, LTC, ETH, etc). Display payment_address and pay_amount for shopper or redirect to payment_url. Can be used to white-label invoices.

This is private API endpoint and requires [authentication](https://developer.coingate.com/docs/api-authentication).

pay_currency.description: Payment cryptocurrency. Possible values: *BTC*, *LTC*, etc. Other cryptocurrencies are processed via a third party and are not accessible with the Checkout method.

lightning_network.description: Lightning network parameter is optional and it is available only for BTC and LTC cryptocurrencies. Maximum available price amount for lightning network orders is 0.042 BTC equivalent.

purchaser_email.description: Email address of the purchaser (payee) provided will be pre-filled on the invoice.

platform_id.description: Is an optional parameter where you can select on what blockchain (platform) the particular digital asset is expected to be received. By default (if the parameter is empty) the system will generate the invoice on the NATIVE blockchain (Binance chain for BNB, Bitcoin chain for BTC, Ethereum chain for ETH, etc.) or on Ethereum blockchain for Tokens (BUSD, DAI USDT, etc.). For more information about available blockchains (platforms) see [here](https://developer.coingate.com/docs/platforms). For more information about blockchain (platform) availability for different currencies see [here](https://developer.coingate.com/docs/currencies).

code-samples.code:
curl https://api.coingate.com/v2/currencies

# Enabled + Native + Crypto
curl https://api.coingate.com/v2/currencies?native=true&enabled=true&kind=crypto

# Merchant Pay
curl https://api.coingate.com/v2/currencies?merchant_pay=true

post.description: Creates a refund for an order. Before making a POST Create Order Refund request, a [POST Create Order](/reference/create-order) request should be made. After an order is created, you will get the order ID which will be used in the POST Create Order Refund request. Platform ID can be found by making a [GET Currencies](/reference/currencies) request and finding the currency in which the refund will be issued. Ledger account ID can be found by making a [GET List Accounts](/reference/accounts) request and finding the ledger account ID associated with the currency in which the refund will be issued. To create requests within the CoinGate system the user should have an authentication token. To get it, please follow the instructions here.

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: ID of the order to be refunded

amount.description: Requesting amount in order price currency to refund

address.description: Cryptocurrency address to which the refund will be sent

currency_id.description: ID of the currency in which the refund will be issued

platform_id.description: Platform ID of the currency in which the refund will be issued

email.description: Customer will receive updates on refund status to this email

ledger_account_id.description: ID of the trader balance associated with the currency in which the refund will be issued

Result.value:
{
	"message": "Refund is not valid",
	"reason": "RefundIsNotValid",
	"errors": [
		"Request amount can't be blank",
		"Request amount must be higher than 1.0 EUR",
		"Request amount is not a number",
		"Refund amount can't be blank",
		"Refund amount is not a number",
		"Balance debit amount can't be blank",
		"Balance debit amount is not a number"
	]
}

get.description: Retrieves all refunds for an order. Before making a GET Order Refunds request, a [POST Create Order](/reference/create-order) request should be made. After an order is created, you will get the order ID which will be used in the GET Order Refunds request.

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: ID of the order to be refunded

get.description: Retrieves all refunds. To create requests within the CoinGate system the user should have an authentication token. To get it, please follow the instructions here.

Retrieves a specific refund for an order. Before making a GET Order Refund request, a [POST Create Order](/reference/create-order) request should be made. After an order is created, you will get the order ID which will be used in the GET Order Refund request. Before making a GET Order Refund request, a [POST Create Order Refund](/reference/create-refund) request should be made. After creating a refund for an order, you will get the refund ID which will be used in the GET Order Refund request.

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: ID of the order to be refunded

get.description: Retrieves all ledger accounts. To create requests within the CoinGate system the user should have an authentication token. To get it, please follow the instructions here.

patch.description: Cancels a specific subscription. Before making a PATCH Cancel Subscription request, a [POST Create Subscription](/reference/create-subscription) request should be made. Then a [PATCH Activate Subscription](/reference/activate-subscription) request should be made to activate the subscription & start accepting payments. After a subscription is created, you will get the subscription ID which will be used in the PATCH Cancel Subscription request. To create requests within the CoinGate system the user should have an authentication token. To get it, please follow the instructions here.

patch.description: Renews a specific canceled subscription. Before making a PATCH Renew Subscription request, a [POST Create Subscription](/reference/create-subscription) request should be made. Then a [PATCH Activate Subscription](/reference/activate-subscription) request should be made to activate the subscription & start accepting payments. And after that the subscription can be canceled with a [PATCH Cancel Subscription](/reference/cancel-subscription) request. After a subscription is created, you will get the subscription ID which will be used in the PATCH Cancel Subscription request. To create requests within the CoinGate system the user should have an authentication token. To get it, please follow the instructions here.

accept_payment.description: If payment was paid in full, you can mark the Accept Payment checkbox on the refund form and we will make every attempt to process this payment, however, it may not be possible and a refund may be required.
